summary: This is an email chain from October 2020 between law enforcement officials discussing the scheduling of an interview with an individual named Mullen and the review of a draft affidavit for an amended search warrant related to drives seized from Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence. It involves coordination between the NYPD, FBI, and the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Paul
persons.role: Recipient of draft affidavit (likely NYPD detective)
persons.context: Addressed in an email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney who sends a draft affidavit for an amended search warrant related to drives from Epstein's residence.

persons.name: Mullen
persons.context: An individual whose interview was canceled and is being rescheduled by law enforcement during the week of October 26, 2020.

connections.description: Paul, as a law enforcement official, is involved in the process related to an interview with Mullen, who is a subject of scheduling by the task force.

events.title: Email coordination for Mullen interview and warrant review
events.description: Law enforcement officials exchange emails to reschedule an interview with Mullen and discuss reviewing a draft affidavit for an amended search warrant.

events.title: Draft affidavit submitted for amended warrant
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney sends a draft affidavit in support of an amended search warrant for three drives seized from Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence to Paul.

keyFacts: In October 2020, law enforcement was actively working on an amended search warrant application for digital drives seized from Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence.
An interview with an individual named Mullen was being scheduled and rescheduled by the NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force.
The correspondence shows coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office (Southern District of New York), the FBI, and the NYPD on the Epstein investigation.
The document references a draft affidavit and exhibits related to the search warrant, indicating ongoing evidence processing.
